metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16592 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd) in GNU Binutils 2.34 in bfd_hash_lookup, as demonstrated in nm-new, that can cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-common - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-for-build - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-for-host - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-multiarch - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-source - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
libbinutils - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
libctf0 - 2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35.50.20201210-0ubuntu2').
